headline: Amazon pays Italy 180 million euros to end tax, labour probe, sources say
summary: An Italian unit of e-commerce giant Amazon has paid compensation and ​scrapped a monitoring system for delivery staff, ‌ending a probe into alleged tax fraud and illegal labour ‌practices, sources with knowledge of the matter said on Friday.  In July 2024 the group's logistics services unit was accused of circumventing labour and tax laws, ⁠relying on cooperatives or ‌limited liability companies that supplied it with workers, avoiding VAT tax and reducing ‍social security payments.
